ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Became proficient with the SuperCollider language.  Learned about and how to implement different approaches to digital audio synthesis.
Super Collider and a whole new system of conceptualizing sound
As a musician it was great to have insight into different synthesis techniques at a foundational level.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The organization was really poor. There should be a syllabus with clear assignments and timelines. Assignments wouldnt be created on Canvas until the day before.

Strengths: Material itself is very interesting, projects were very effective at stimulating growth.

Weaknesses:  Lectures were frequently difficult to follow.  In general, I think the class would benefit from clearer learning objectives (although I think the problem is in large part due to the discrepancies in prior knowledge that different students come to the class with).
Scott is such a character. You love him or you cant stand him. I loved
Strengths definitely lie in the tinkering coding projects. Lectures can be a bit dry and could be improved with some more general cohesiveness.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: It was a frustrating course due to the disorganization. However, Professor Petersen is a nice guy and the concepts are interesting!
Yes, if you are interested in computer music and are willing to put a reasonable amount of effort in.
I think this class is alright, but I wish I had more music knowledge coming in.
I would recommend this class if you're at all musical. For the non-music CS majors, it can be a bit tricky to pickup all of the technical lingo.
